lines.text: Your mama's so old, she was there the first day of slavery.
Your mama's so old, she older than your grandmama.
Your mama's so fat, she own both sides of the family.
That's okay. You mama's so dumb, she thought a quarterback was a refund.
Your mama's so dumb, they told her it was chilly outside, she went inside and got a bowl.
Come on, baby. Let's get out of here.
I think it's time to flush and leave.
You can have him. I don't have a problem getting a man.
Well, girlfriend. Here's some lotion for your ashy ankles. That'll make it even easier.
That's okay. Your mama's so country, she got an elevator, thought it was a mobile home.
You know what that was all about, right? He still loves you.
We don't die, we multiply.
I am pissed off to the highest level of pissivity.

[Upon seeing Jamika for the first time]
She looked so good, she made a brother wanna get a JOB... with benefits!

Please familiarize and observe the rules while in Fun World. No running, no jumping, no yelling, no cutting in line, no grumbling, no stealing. That means you. No breaking things and putting them back like nothing happened. No sad faces, bad attitudes, introspective moments, irritation at the mindless happiness of the masses, and no littering. Is that clear? Enjoy your stay.
If you don't tell me where your little brother is, I'm gonna beat the black off you, and you're gonna look lighter than Michael Jackson.
They were eating so fast, I had to spit on my food to keep 'em from taking mine.
I feel sorry for trouble if it runs into them kids.
I got bags big enough under my eyes to carry fifty dollars worth of groceries.
Are we petty, vengeful humans, or logical, moral machines? Then pass judgment.
Your mama's so old, she was there the first day of slavery.
No wonder we're not gettin' anywhere! Get some of this food off the boat!
But I need it to live!
I ain't never been glad to see the cops before. But I was sure happy then. Happier than a runaway slave, papers and all.
If you tried to phone hell from here, it'd be a local call.
Those kids don't stand a chance in that neighborhood.
No, I don't think that neighborhood stands a chance against them kids.
Excuse me, Miss. I didn't catch your name.
I didn't throw it.
And this is little Pee-Wee.
Pee-Wee, O.G.!
O.G.? I'll slap my F-O-O-T in your B-U-T.
Even a circus can't train those kids.
Now Jamicka, I don't mean to get in your business. But maybe you should sign your son up for some karate classes. Boy kinda soft!
I thought the devil was through when he made Rosemary's Baby, but ohhhhhhh no! Oh no! Now we got, Bebe's Kids!
Test tube babies!
